ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometry

Class OdometryCorrection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometry.OdometryCorrection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LightSensorUser

    public class OdometryCorrection
extends java.lang.Object
implements LightSensorUser
    This class controls odometry correction. It uses an existing instance of the odometer since it is a singleton pattern. The run method performs odometry correction using both light sensors at the back of the robot
    Author:
    Matthew, Lara

    • Constructor Detail

      • OdometryCorrection

        public OdometryCorrection(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                          EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor)
                   throws OdometerExceptions
        This is the default class constructor. An existing instance of the odometer is used. This is to ensure thread safety.
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

    • Method Detail

      • processLSData

        public void processLSData(int[] light)
        Here is where the odometry correction code is run. It updates the odometer each time the light sensors cross a line.
        Specified by:
        processLSData in interface LightSensorUser
        Parameters:
        light - light sensor values read by the light sensor

      • correctOdometer

        private void correctOdometer(int leadingSensor)
        This method determines what the corrected values for the odometer are and applies them
        Parameters:
        leadingSensor - which sensor detected a line first (0 = left, 1 = right)
